section.title: Servers

para.emphasis: Servers have a server-role which determines how they will be used in the cloud.

section.para: Servers (in the input model) enumerate the resources available for your cloud. In addition, in this definition file you can either provide &kw-hos; with all of the details it needs to PXE boot and install an operating system onto the server, or, if you prefer to use your own operating system installation tooling you can simply provide the details needed to be able to SSH into the servers and start the deployment.

The address specified for the server will be the one used by &kw-hos; for lifecycle management and must be part of a network which is in the input model. If you are using &kw-hos; to install the operating system this network must be an untagged VLAN. The first server must be installed manually from the &kw-hos; ISO and this server must be included in the input model as well.
In addition to the network details used to install or connect to the server, each server defines what its server-role is and to which server-group it belongs.
